clinical_study.brief_title: Characterization of Dyslipidemia in Adolescent Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Characterization of Dyslipidemia in Adolescent Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this pilot study is to characterize the profile of lipoprotein, inflammatory, and metabolic markers of cardiovascular disease in obese adolescents as compared to normal-weight age-matched controls.

primary_outcome.description: To characterize and compare lipoprotein, inflammation and metabolic markers in obese and normal weight adolescents.

study_pop.textblock: Enrollment will be representative of the ethnic population of Charlotte, NC, estimated as 50% Caucasian, 35% African American, 10% Hispanic, and 5 % other.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 13-19

Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior diagnosis of any eating disorder (e.g. anorexia or bulimia)
- Prior diagnosis of any congenital lipid disorder (e.g. familial hypercholesterolemia)
- Current use (or within past 6 months) of any lipid altering medications
